bioghist.p: The American Association of Textile Chemists and Colorists (AATCC), founded in 1921, is an organization that promotes knowledge of the application of dyes and chemicals in the textile industry and encourages research on chemical processes related to the dye and textile industries.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists primarily of bound volumes of circulars from the General Dyestuffs Corporation. These volumes were collected by the AATCC. Each volume is organized by color, and includes technical data about the dyes, as well as samples of dyed fabric and yarn. The collection also includes a scrapbook of fabrics woven by George Manton, three photo albums of exhibits from the AATCC Silver Jubilee in 1946, a ledger of dye samples from various sources, a scrapbook of fabric samples showing results of washing/fading tests, and a bound "Pre-War Color Index."

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
